page.title: 08THE TANFIELD RAILWAY SOCIETY
page.content: {The Tanfield Railway Association}was founded in 1975.Its aim is to preserve part of the Tanfield Railway which is the oldest operating railway in the world. In 1985 the track is 1 mile long and runs from Marley Hill Engine Shed to Sunniside. It is open to the public every Sunday in June,July and August, and Bank holidays,when a steam engine pulls three carriages along the track. The members of the Tanfield Railway Association restore engines. Their oldest engine is a Wellington built by Black-Hawthorn,Gateshead in 1873.At the moment there are 27 engines, all of which have been given to them,and 3 carriages.Eventually it is hoped to extend the line a further 2 miles to Tanfield.More track has to be laid,4 stations and a road bridge built and more rolling stock acquired.
